com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.viewstate

Interface RestorableViewState<V extends MvpView>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ViewState<V>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ParcelableLceViewState<D,V>, RestorableParcelableViewState<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsParcelableLceViewState, ArrayListLceViewState, CastedArrayListLceViewState, ParcelableDataLceViewState, ParcelableListLceViewState, SerializeableLceViewState, VoidViewState

    public interface RestorableViewState<V extends MvpView>
extends ViewState<V>
    A ViewState that is parcelable. Activities can only use this kind of ViewState, because saving the ViewState in a bundle as Parcelable during screen orientation changes (from portrait to landscape or vice versa) is the only way to do that for activities
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RestorableViewState<V> restoreInstanceState(Bundle in)
      Restores the viewstate that has been saved before with saveInstanceState(Bundle)
      void saveInstanceState(Bundle out)
      Saves this ViewState to the outgoing bundle.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.viewstate.ViewState

        apply

    • Method Detail

      • saveInstanceState

        void saveInstanceState(Bundle out)
        Saves this ViewState to the outgoing bundle. This will typically be called in android.app.Activity#onSaveInstanceState(Bundle) or in android.app.Fragment#onSaveInstanceState(Bundle)
        Parameters:
        out - The bundle where the viewstate should be stored in

      • restoreInstanceState

        RestorableViewState<V> restoreInstanceState(Bundle in)
        Restores the viewstate that has been saved before with saveInstanceState(Bundle)
        Parameters:
        in - the bundle to read the data from
        Returns:
        null, if view state could not be restored or the restore viestate instance. Typically this method will return this.
